subject: Business
title: Viral Loops and Word of Mouth
description: A micro-lesson that makes Viral Loops and Word of Mouth usable.

hook.text: Hotmail added 'Get your free email at Hotmail' to every message. 12 million users in 18 months.

buildup.text: A viral loop means each new user naturally brings in more users as part of using the product.

discovery.text: The viral coefficient K measures this: if K is above 1, each user brings more than one new user.

twist.text: True virality is rare. Most 'viral' products grow through paid ads dressed up as organic buzz.

climax.text: Dropbox cracked it with referrals: give storage to get storage. Users became the sales team.

punchline.text: Make sharing part of using the product.

quiz.question: What does a viral coefficient (K) greater than 1 mean?
options: Each user brings in more than one new user on average
The product has over one million users
